thinking.disposable_income: Riverdale has one of the lowest median household incomes in Chicago at around $13,795. About 45% of households live below the poverty line, making residents highly sensitive to any cost increases.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With such low income levels, residents have very limited discretionary spending. Most income goes to basic necessities. Any additional transportation costs or sales tax would significantly impact household budgets.
thinking.accessibility: Riverdale is relatively isolated on the far South Side with limited transit options. Many residents rely on public transit due to low car ownership rates (about 30% of households don't have vehicles). The community faces long commute times and accessibility challenges to jobs and services.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Given very low incomes, prioritize lowest combined costs (fare + tax). 2. Need improved transit service due to high transit dependency. 3. Lower driving fees since many essential workers need cars. 4. Policy 0 ranks first with lowest tax and fare, though transit time is higher. 5. Policies 1,9,3,10 follow as they balance low costs with moderate service improvements. 6. Avoided high tax/fare/fee combinations due to severe budget constraints of residents.
